verses.verse: Then<WG3767> verily<WG3303> the first<WG4413> covenant had<WG2192> also<WG2532> ordinances<WG1345> of divine service<WG2999>, and<WG5037> a worldly<WG2886> sanctuary<WG39>.

For<WG1063> there was<WG2680> a tabernacle<WG4633> made<WG2680>; the first<WG4413>, wherein<WG1722><WG3739><WG5037> was the candlestick<WG3087>, and<WG2532> the table<WG5132>, and<WG2532> the shewbread<WG4286><WG740>; which<WG3748> is called<WG3004> the sanctuary<WG39>.
And<WG1161> after<WG3326> the second<WG1208> veil<WG2665>, the tabernacle<WG4633> which<WG3588> is called<WG3004> the Holiest of all<WG39><WG39>;

Which had<WG2192> the golden<WG5552> censer<WG2369>, and<WG2532> the ark<WG2787> of the covenant<WG1242> overlaid<WG4028> round about<WG3840> with gold<WG5553>, wherein<WG1722><WG3739> was the golden<WG5552> pot<WG4713> that had<WG2192> manna<WG3131>, and<WG2532> Aaron's<WG2> rod<WG4464> that budded<WG985>, and<WG2532> the tables<WG4109> of the covenant<WG1242>;

And<WG1161> over<WG5231> it<WG846> the cherubims<WG5502> of glory<WG1391> shadowing<WG2683> the mercyseat<WG2435>; of<WG4012> which<WG3739> we cannot<WG3756><WG2076> now<WG3568> speak<WG3004> particularly<WG2596><WG3313>.

Now<WG1161> when these things<WG5130> were<WG2680> thus<WG3779> ordained<WG2680>, the priests<WG2409> went<WG1524> always<WG1275> into<WG1519><WG3303> the first<WG4413> tabernacle<WG4633>, accomplishing<WG2005> the service<WG2999> of God.

But<WG1161> into<WG1519> the second<WG1208> went the high priest<WG749> alone<WG3441> once<WG530> every year<WG1763>, not<WG3756> without<WG5565> blood<WG129>, which<WG3739> he offered<WG4374> for<WG5228> himself<WG1438>, and<WG2532> for the errors<WG51> of the people<WG2992>:

The Holy<WG40> Ghost<WG4151> this<WG5124> signifying<WG1213>, that the way<WG3598> into the holiest of all<WG39> was<WG5319> not yet<WG3380> made manifest<WG5319>, while as the first<WG4413> tabernacle<WG4633> was<WG2192> yet<WG2089> standing<WG4714>:

Which<WG3748> was a figure<WG3850> for<WG1519> the time<WG2540> then present<WG1764>, in<WG2596> which<WG3739> were offered<WG4374> both<WG5037> gifts<WG1435> and<WG2532> sacrifices<WG2378>, that could<WG1410> not<WG3361> make<WG5048> him that did the service<WG3000> perfect<WG5048>, as pertaining to<WG2596> the conscience<WG4893>;

Which stood only<WG3440> in<WG1909> meats<WG1033> and<WG2532> drinks<WG4188>, and<WG2532> divers<WG1313> washings<WG909>, and<WG2532> carnal<WG4561> ordinances<WG1345>, imposed<WG1945> on them until<WG3360> the time<WG2540> of reformation<WG1357>.

But<WG1161> Christ<WG5547> being come<WG3854> an high priest<WG749> of good things<WG18> to come<WG3195>, by<WG1223> a greater<WG3187> and<WG2532> more perfect<WG5046> tabernacle<WG4633>, not<WG3756> made with hands<WG5499>, that is to say<WG5123>, not<WG3756> of this<WG5026> building<WG2937>;

Neither<WG3761> by<WG1223> the blood<WG129> of goats<WG5131> and<WG2532> calves<WG3448>, but<WG1161> by<WG1223> his own<WG2398> blood<WG129> he entered in<WG1525> once<WG2178> into<WG1519> the holy place<WG39>, having obtained<WG2147> eternal<WG166> redemption<WG3085> for us.

For<WG1063> if<WG1487> the blood<WG129> of bulls<WG5022> and<WG2532> of goats<WG5131>, and<WG2532> the ashes<WG4700> of an heifer<WG1151> sprinkling<WG4472> the unclean<WG2840>, sanctifieth<WG37> to<WG4314> the purifying<WG2514> of the flesh<WG4561>:

How much<WG4214> more<WG3123> shall<WG2511> the blood<WG129> of Christ<WG5547>, who<WG3739> through<WG1223> the eternal<WG166> Spirit<WG4151> offered<WG4374> himself<WG1438> without spot<WG299> to God<WG2316>, purge<WG2511> your<WG5216> conscience<WG4893> from<WG575> dead<WG3498> works<WG2041> to<WG1519> serve<WG3000> the living<WG2198> God<WG2316>?

And<WG2532> for this<WG5124> cause<WG1223> he is<WG2076> the mediator<WG3316> of the new<WG2537> testament<WG1242>, that<WG3704> by means<WG1096> of death<WG2288>, for<WG1519> the redemption<WG629> of the transgressions<WG3847> that were under<WG1909> the first<WG4413> testament<WG1242>, they which are called<WG2564> might receive<WG2983> the promise<WG1860> of eternal<WG166> inheritance<WG2817>.
For<WG1063> where<WG3699> a testament<WG1242> is, there must also of necessity<WG318> be<WG5342> the death<WG2288> of the testator<WG1303>.

For<WG1063> a testament<WG1242> is of force<WG949> after<WG1909> men are dead<WG3498>: otherwise<WG1893> it is of<WG2480> no<WG3379> strength<WG2480> at all<WG3379> while<WG3753> the testator<WG1303> liveth<WG2198>.
Whereupon<WG3606> neither<WG3761> the first<WG4413> testament was dedicated<WG1457> without<WG5565> blood<WG129>.

For<WG1063> when<WG5259> Moses<WG3475> had spoken<WG2980> every<WG3956> precept<WG1785> to all<WG3956> the people<WG2992> according<WG2596> to the law<WG3551>, he took<WG2983> the blood<WG129> of calves<WG3448> and<WG2532> of goats<WG5131>, with<WG3326> water<WG5204>, and<WG2532> scarlet<WG2847> wool<WG2053>, and<WG2532> hyssop<WG5301>, and sprinkled<WG4472> both<WG5037> the book<WG975><WG846>, and<WG2532> all<WG3956> the people<WG2992>,
Saying<WG3004>, This<WG5124> is the blood<WG129> of the testament<WG1242> which<WG3739> God<WG2316> hath enjoined<WG1781> unto<WG4314> you<WG5209>.
Moreover<WG1161><WG3668> he sprinkled<WG4472> with blood<WG129> both<WG2532> the tabernacle<WG4633>, and<WG2532> all<WG3956> the vessels<WG4632> of the ministry<WG3009>.

And<WG2532> almost<WG4975> all things<WG3956> are<WG2511> by<WG2596> the law<WG3551> purged<WG2511> with<WG1722> blood<WG129>; and<WG2532> without<WG5565> shedding of blood<WG130> is<WG1096> no<WG3756> remission<WG859>.

It was therefore<WG3767> necessary<WG318> that the patterns<WG5262> of things<WG3303> in<WG1722> the heavens<WG3772> should be purified<WG2511> with these<WG5125>; but<WG1161> the heavenly things<WG2032> themselves<WG846> with better<WG2909> sacrifices<WG2378> than<WG3844> these<WG5025>.

For<WG1063> Christ<WG5547> is<WG1525> not<WG3756> entered<WG1525> into<WG1519> the holy places<WG39> made with hands<WG5499>, which are the figures<WG499> of the true<WG228>; but<WG235> into<WG1519> heaven<WG3772> itself<WG846>, now<WG3568> to appear<WG1718> in the presence<WG4383> of God<WG2316> for<WG5228> us<WG2257>:

Nor<WG3761> yet that<WG2443> he should offer<WG4374> himself<WG1438> often<WG4178>, as<WG5618> the high priest<WG749> entereth<WG1525> into<WG1519> the holy place<WG39> every<WG2596> year<WG1763> with<WG1722> blood<WG129> of others<WG245>;

For then<WG1893> must<WG1163> he<WG846> often<WG4178> have suffered<WG3958> since<WG575> the foundation<WG2602> of the world<WG2889>: but<WG1161> now<WG3568> once<WG530> in<WG1909> the end<WG4930> of the world<WG165> hath he appeared<WG5319> to<WG1519> put away<WG115> sin<WG266> by<WG1223> the sacrifice<WG2378> of himself<WG846>.
And<WG2532> as<WG2596><WG3745> it is appointed<WG606> unto men<WG444> once<WG530> to die<WG599>, but<WG1161> after<WG3326> this<WG5124> the judgment<WG2920>:

So<WG3779> Christ<WG5547> was once<WG530> offered<WG4374> to<WG1519> bear<WG399> the sins<WG266> of many<WG4183>; and unto them that look<WG553> for him<WG846> shall he appear<WG3700><WG1537> the second time<WG1208> without<WG5565> sin<WG266> unto<WG1519> salvation<WG4991>.
